docs.text: this summer , one of the most racially charged novels in john grisham's series , a time to kill , was made into a major motion picture .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: on january 3 of this year , director rob reiner basically re-released the film under the title of ghosts of mississippi .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: based on the true story of 1963 civil rights leader medgar evars' assassination , ghosts of mississippi revolves around the 25-year legal battle faced by myrlie evars ( whoopi goldberg , sister act ) and her quest to have her husband's obvious assassin and racist byron de la beckwith ( james woods , casino ) jailed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so she turns to assistant district attorney and prosecutor bobby delaughter ( alec baldwin , heaven's prisoners ) to imprison the former kkk member .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ghosts sets its tone with an opening montage of images from african-american history , from slave-ship miseries to life in the racist south of the 1960's .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but all too soon , the white folks take over , intoning lines like " what's america got to do with anything ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is mississippi ! "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as beckwith , james woods , with his head larded with latex most of the time as an old man , teeters between portraying evil and its character .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: meanwhile , goldberg turns in a very serious and weepy performance as the wife who wouldn't let her husband's death rest until she got the conviction .

docs.text: both deserve serious oscar-consideration .

docs.text: this brings us to the dull performance of baldwin .

docs.text: let's face it , trying to match matthew mcconaughey's wonderful acting in a time to kill is basically impossible .

docs.text: and baldwin is living proof of this , as no emotions could be felt .

docs.text: either poor acting or poor directing , but something definitely went wrong .

docs.text: another strange mishap was the fact that goldberg's facial features didn't change , as she looked the same in the courtroom as she did holding her husband's dead body 25-years earlier .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: yet woods' was plastered with enough make up to make him look like goldberg's father .

docs.text: at least the make-up was realistic .

docs.text: with some emotional moments in the poorly written script , ghosts of mississippi lacked in heart , when its predecessor , a time to kill , brought tears to everyone's eyes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: don't get me wrong , the movie wasn't all that bad , but if you've seen grisham's masterpiece , then don't expect this one to be an excellent film .
